<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_softirq_set:
```c
void metal_softirq_set(int irq)
{
	struct metal_irq_controller *cntr;

	cntr = &metal_softirq_cntr;

	if (irq < cntr->irq_base ||
	    irq >= (cntr->irq_base + cntr->irq_num)) {
		return;
	}

	irq -= cntr->irq_base;
	atomic_store(&metal_softirq_pending[irq], 1);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_softirq_set:

	int irq_base; /**< Start of IRQ number of the range managed by

	int irq_num; /**< Number of IRQs managed by the IRQ controller */
	void *arg; /**< Argument to pass to interrupt controller function */
	metal_irq_set_enable irq_set_enable; /**< function to set IRQ enable */
	metal_cntr_irq_register irq_register; /**< function to register IRQ
						* handler
						*/

explanation: Only one function parameter (irq) is present and it is modified in the function. The assignment 'irq -= cntr->irq_base;' directly modifies the parameter and therefore must be investigated per MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8. Other lines do not violate the rule: 'cntr' is a local pointer variable assigned from a file-scope object (&metal_softirq_cntr), not a parameter; the comparisons (irq < cntr->irq_base, irq >= ...) only read the parameter; atomic_store(&metal_softirq_pending[irq], 1) modifies the object referenced by an array/pointer (allowed) and does not modify the parameter itself; the struct and macro definitions are declarations, not parameter modifications. No other parameter modifications are present in the provided code.
